intro: Conyzella, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture, and its flowers are typically yellow or brown. Conyzella is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain environments. It plays a role in both ecological systems and agricultural settings due to its growth habits.
